Respicite Exemplar Vitæ────
“How vain are Mortal Man's Endeavours!
“Said at SṭJames's, Master Travers.
“Good Orleans Dead!──In truth, 'tis hard!
“May Statesmen all, dye so prepar'd!
“I do foresee (and for foreseeing
He equalls any Man in being)
“The Army ne'er can be disbanded──
“I wish the King were safely Landed:──
“Ah friends! Great Changes threat this Land;
“All France and England at a Stand!
“There's Miriweys d'ye mark! strange Work!
“And there's the Czar; and there's the Turk!
“The Pope”────An India Merchant by
Cut short his Speech with this Reply.
“All at a Stand! You see; Great Changes!
“Sir, did you ever see the Ganges?
“There dwells a Race, we call 'em Monkeys
(Grave, Sober, Sage, as our Quid nuncis.)
“On either Bank, from bough to bough,
“They meet, and Chat as we do now:
“Whispers go round, they grin, they Shrug,
“They bow, they Snarle, they Scratch, they hug;
“And just as Chance or Whim provoke 'em,
“They either Bite their friends, or stroke 'em.“There have I seen some Active Prig,
“To shew his Parts, bestride a twig;
“Lord! how the chatt'ring tribe admire
“Not that he's Wiser, but is Higher!
“All long to try the Vent'rous thing,
(For Power is but to have one's Swing)
“From Side to Side he springs, he Spurns,
“And bangs his Foes and Friends by turns.
“Thus, as in giddy freaks he bounces,
“Crack goes the twig, and in he flounces;
“Down the Swift Stream the Wretch is born
“Never, ah! never to return.“Zounds! what a Fall has our Dear Brother!
“Morbleu, cries one, and Dam──e 'tother:
“The Nations give a Gen'ral Scinshriech.
“None cocks his Tail, none claws his br──ch;
“Each trembles for the Publick Weal,
“And for a while forgets to Steal:
“A while, all Eyes intent and Steady,
“Pursue Him whirling down the Eddy;
“But, out of mind when out of View,
“Some other mounts the twig a new,
“And Bus'ness on Each Monkey Shore
“Runs the same track it went before.Y20-760L
